# Interactive GCC [![tests](https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc/actions/workflows/main.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc/actions/workflows/main.yml) [![contrib](https://img.shields.io/badge/contributions-welcome-brightgreen.svg?style=flat)](https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc/issues) [![Code style: black](https://img.shields.io/badge/code%20style-black-000000.svg)](https://github.com/psf/black) > [!NOTE] > The original repo from Andy Balaam is here: https://codeberg.org/andybalaam/igcc.

# Interactive GCC [![tests](https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc/actions/workflows/main.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc/actions/workflows/main.yml) [![contrib](https://img.shields.io/badge/contributions-welcome-brightgreen.svg?style=flat)](https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc/issues) [![Code style: black](https://img.shields.io/badge/code%20style-black-000000.svg)](https://github.com/psf/black) > [!NOTE] > The original repository from Andy Balaam is here: https://codeberg.org/andybalaam/igcc.

RowTranslations.originContent: > The original repo from Andy Balaam is here: https://codeberg.org/andybalaam/igcc.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: > The original repository from Andy Balaam is here: https://codeberg.org/andybalaam/igcc.

Content:
> In this fork, I've done some refactoring and tried to make it easier to use.

> [!WARNING]
> This project is a hacky attempt at getting a shorter feedback loop when working with C/C++ in some cases and it's obviously not intended for anything serious.

Interactive GCC (`igcc`) is a read-eval-print loop (REPL) for C/C++. It works by manipulating a base source file with user commands, compiles the source after each modification, then executes the resulting binary and collects its stdout & stderr.
Multi-line (block) input is supported, so you can add multiple lines in one go and invoke the compiler just once (examples below).

You can include various header files. For convenience, a default header is included: [`boilerplate.h`](https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc/blob/main/igcc/assets/boilerplate.h). Also, `using namespace std;` is not available by default, but you can explicitly add it (example below).

Various aspects of `igcc` can be configured, see [`config.yaml`](https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc/blob/main/igcc/assets/config.yaml).

## Getting started
The easiest way to get started is to use [pipx](https://pipx.pypa.io/stable/):
Translation:

> [!WARNING]
> This project is a hacky attempt at getting a shorter feedback loop when working with C/C++ in some cases and it's obviously not intended for anything serious.

Interactive GCC (`igcc`) is a read-eval-print loop (REPL) for C/C++. It works by manipulating a base source file with user commands, compiles the source after each modification, then executes the resulting binary and collects its stdout & stderr.
Multi-line (block) input is supported, so you can add multiple lines in one go and invoke the compiler just once (examples below).

You can include various header files. For convenience, a default header is included: [`boilerplate.h`](https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc/blob/main/igcc/assets/boilerplate.h). Also, `using namespace std;` is not available by default, but you can explicitly add it (example below).

Various aspects of `igcc` can be configured, see [`config.yaml`](https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc/blob/main/igcc/assets/config.yaml).

## Getting started
The easiest way to get started is to use [pipx](https://pipx.pypa.io/stable/):

RowTranslations.originContent: The easiest way to get started is to use [pipx](https://pipx.pypa.io/stable/):
RowTranslations.translatedContent: The easiest way to get started is to use [pipx](https://pipx.pypa.io/stable/):

Content:
```
pipx install git+https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc.git
```
Translation:
```
pipx install git+https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc.git
```

Content: Alternatively, you can also use `uv`:
Translation: Alternatively, you can also use `uv`:

Content:
```
uv tool run git+https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc
```
Translation:
```
uv tool run git+https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc
```

Content: And for dev:
Translation: And for dev:

Content:
```
git clone https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc.git
cd igcc
uv sync
```
Translation:
```
git clone https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc.git
cd igcc
uv sync
```

Content:
Available args:
<!-- MDUP:BEG uv run igcc --help -->
Translation:
Available args:
<!-- MDUP:BEG uv run igcc --help -->

Content:
```
usage: igcc [-h] [-I INCLUDE [INCLUDE ...]] [-L LIBDIR [LIBDIR ...]]
            [-l LIB [LIB ...]]

options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -I INCLUDE [INCLUDE ...]
                        Add INCLUDE to the list of directories to be searched
                        for header files.
  -L LIBDIR [LIBDIR ...]
                        Add LIBDIR to the list of directories to be searched
                        for library files.
  -l LIB [LIB ...]      Search the library LIB when linking.
```
Translation:
```
usage: igcc [-h] [-I INCLUDE [INCLUDE ...]] [-L LIBDIR [LIBDIR ...]]
            [-l LIB [LIB ...]]

options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -I INCLUDE [INCLUDE ...]
                        Add INCLUDE to the list of directories to be searched
                        for header files.
  -L LIBDIR [LIBDIR ...]
                        Add LIBDIR to the list of directories to be searched
                        for library files.
  -l LIB [LIB ...]      Search the library LIB when linking.
```

RowTranslations.translatedContent: -h, --help            show this help message and exit

RowTranslations.originContent: Add INCLUDE to the list of directories to be searched
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Add INCLUDE to the list of directories to be searched

RowTranslations.originContent: Add LIBDIR to the list of directories to be searched
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Add LIBDIR to the list of directories to be searched

RowTranslations.originContent: -l LIB [LIB ...]      Search the library LIB when linking.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: -l LIB [LIB ...]      Search the library LIB when linking.

Content:
<!-- MDUP:END -->

The code will be compiled with GCC (`g++`) and the results (if any) will be displayed.
Type `.h` for help:
Translation:
<!-- MDUP:END -->

The code will be compiled with GCC (`g++`) and the results (if any) will be displayed.
Type `.h` for help:

RowTranslations.originContent: The code will be compiled with GCC (`g++`) and the results (if any) will be displayed.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: The code will be compiled with GCC (`g++`) and the results (if any) will be displayed.

Content:
```
$ igcc
[1]> .h
.h  Show this help message
.e  Show the last compile errors/warnings
.l  List the code you have entered
.L  List the whole program as given to the compiler
.r  Redo undone command
.u  Undo previous command
.q  Quit
```
Translation:
```
$ igcc
[1]> .h
.h  Show this help message
.e  Show the last compile errors/warnings
.l  List the code you have entered
.L  List the whole program as given to the compiler
.r  Redo undone command
.u  Undo previous command
.q  Quit
```

Content: ## Examples
Translation: ## Examples

Content: **Multi-line input** is supported (check `multiline_marker` from config). The benefit is avoiding multiple compiler calls.
Translation: **Multi-line input** is supported (check `multiline_marker` from config). The benefit is avoiding multiple compiler calls.

Translation: You can include headers:

Translation: Libs can be linked:

Translation: You can also **undo** commands:

Content: ... or **redo** previously undone commands:
Translation: ... or **redo** previously undone commands:

Content:
## Future work
See https://github.com/alexandru-dinu/igcc/issues

## Similar projects
- https://github.com/BenBrock/reple: "Replay-based" REPLs for compiled languages
- https://github.com/root-project/cling: The cling C++ interpreter


## Credits
- [IGCC home page](http://www.artificialworlds.net/wiki/IGCC/IGCC)
- [IGCC Sourceforge page](http://sourceforge.net/projects/igcc/)
- [Andy Balaam's home page](http://www.artificialworlds.net)
- [Andy Balaam's blog](http://www.artificialworlds.net/blog)
- Andy Balaam may be contacted on axis3x3 at users dot sourceforge dot net
- IGCC is Copyright (C) 2009 Andy Balaam
- IGCC is Free Software released under the terms of the GNU General Public License version 3
- IGCC comes with NO WARRANTY
